summary: 911 call centers get about 240 million phone calls a year. Some of the nation's call centers are working to upgrade to the next generation of technology. The new systems can provide more information to first responders, and can receive text messages, images, and more—in addition to traditional phone calls. We found: 7 of the 11 federal agencies operating 911 call centers were upgrading, but...
title: Next Generation 911: Some Federal Agencies Have Begun Planning, but Few Have Upgraded Their Call Centers
